DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Whatever you say, boss.
RESPONSE TEXT: Back when Colter first took over, he had big ideas, and he made some big promises.
His plan was to get the power plant back online and light up the whole park, making it easier to conquer, and safer for all of us.
We could have done it, too, but things changed. Slowed down. Colter stopped pushing, stopped caring so much.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I think Colter was on to something. Having full power in the park would make everything easier.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Colter had the right idea. I just might finish what he started.
RESPONSE TEXT: I hope you do, boss.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ChipMorse: Truth is, I've dreamed about that day more than once. Not sure why, really.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Restoring power sounds like a waste of time. We've already got everything we need right here.
RESPONSE TEXT: Of course. We'll do whatever you say.
Still... it would be a sight, all these lights coming back on... All the color.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ChipMorse: Truth is, I've dreamed about that day more than once. Not sure why, really.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You seem pretty well informed about Colter's plans.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, yeah. Colter needed my input on getting the power plant running again.
I'm sort of the unofficial chief handyman around here, or as close as we've got to one.
Guess you could say I've got a vested interest in the plan to get the power back on.
Speaking of which, do you think you'll see it through? Colter's plan, I mean?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Colter had the right idea. I just might finish what he started.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What poor bastards are you talking about?
RESPONSE TEXT: Back when the Raiders took over, some of us - the traders who were here before, I mean - got away.
Last I heard, those folks were holed up in Dry Rock Gulch. They're probably struggling, if they're alive at all.
Do you think you'll follow through on Colter's plan? Get the juice flowing again?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Colter had the right idea. I just might finish what he started.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What poor bastards are you talking about?
RESPONSE TEXT: Uh... you know what? Just forget I said that.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Colter had the right idea. I just might finish what he started.
SCRIPT NOTES: Sheepish, said something you should not have / Worried

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I hope you do, boss.
RESPONSE TEXT: Truth is, I've dreamed about that day more than once. Not sure why, really.
Maybe I've just grown attached to the place, what with all the work I've done on it.
Sounds funny, I know, but I think Nuka-World is something really special. I think she deserves to have her lights shine again.
And just imagine... at night, you'd see it for miles around. Folk would talk about it. They'd come from all over to shop in the market.
That's a lot of caps for you and the gangs.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: When you put it that way, it does sound like a pretty good idea.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: When you put it that way, it does sound like a pretty good idea.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's your call, boss, but there's plenty of time to figure things out.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ChipMorse: Gotta get back to work here. See you around, boss.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You've wasted enough of my time, scab. Get back to work.
RESPONSE TEXT: Whatever you say, boss.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ChipMorse: Gotta get back to work here. See you around, boss.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You're dreaming if you think turning on some lights is going to magically transform this place into something great.
RESPONSE TEXT: A dream? Yeah, maybe, but I've got to hold onto something. Most days, that's all I've got.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ChipMorse: Gotta get back to work here. See you around, boss.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How long have you been here?
RESPONSE TEXT: Been about twenty years now, I guess. For better or worse, Nuka-World is my home.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ChipMorse: Gotta get back to work here. See you around, boss.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's your call, boss, but there's plenty of time to figure things out.

What?
Huh?
Hey there, boss. You really laid a beat-down on Colter. That was something.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ChipMorse: Guess that means his big plans for the park died with him.

RESPONSE TEXT: Park sure is a sight, what with all the lights on.
You really did it. You got the power plant up and running and everything.
No more Raiders... if this is a dream, don't wake me up.
SCRIPT NOTES: Mix of gratitude and disbelief / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: You really taught those Raiders a lesson.
Hey, boss. Good to see you.
Being chief handyman basically means I'm the one who gets yelled at, threatened and kicked around when something breaks.
If I said I loved my job, I'd be lying. At least the Raiders find me useful, so they mostly leave me alone.
I spend half my time trying to squeeze every ounce of power I can out of this place. Never feels like enough, though.
You wouldn't believe some of the stuff that comes out of the pipes around here. To call it "sewage" would be paying it a compliment.
Believe it or not, I haven't had a Raider threaten to cut my face off for at least four hours. Maybe my luck is changing...
I swear, half the manhole covers I open have ghouls waiting under them.
My definition of a good day is one where I don't find a nest of bloodworms in a utility tunnel.
Always wished I could ride some of the attractions here. Even now, they still look like a lot of fun.
Doing alright there, boss?
SCRIPT NOTES: Curious why the player has stopped talking
